radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple round, low-attenuation lesions within the subcortical white matter, the largest within the left centrum semiovale. Normal ventricles, sulci, cisterns, orbits, and paranasal sinuses. No evidence of intraparenchymal or extra-axial hemorrhage or infarct.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: A subsequent CT scan was unchanged.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple nodular and ring-enhancing lesions in the deep white matter of both cerebral hemispheres. Chains of small nodules with larger ring-enhancing components. Lesions believed to be typical signs of infection.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up imaging showed dramatic resolution of the ring-enhancing lesions and minimal remaining white-matter abnormalities.

radiographic_examinations.date: 35 months earlier than the current dates in the report

radiographic_examinations.findings: Well-circumscribed, low-density, non-enhancing lesions in the left and right hepatic lobes, consistent with cysts. Left kidney absent, other solid organs normal.
Several low-attenuation lesions within the thyroid gland, consistent with thyroid cysts or small goiter. No supraclavicular or axillary lymphadenopathy detected.
Slight dilatation of the aortic root (41 mm). No evidence of valvular vegetations or significant regurgitation. Size and systolic function of the left ventricle normal. No pericardial effusion.
